result.execSummary:
The defendant Paris G Crossley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $500.00 to victim Michael S.  To be paid first, before costs/surcharges, etc.

Pay the DNA surcahrge, costs and disbursements.
*Court ordered monies taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  If not paid, will result in a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF4053.  Credit for 512 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain his GED and an Associate Degree.
Cooperate and participate with mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.
No contact with the victims Joliene Y. and Michael S.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  No controlled substances or alcohol.  Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised he is not allowed to possess any body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF4053.  
---Defendant is eligible for the  Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after six (6) years of incarceration.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Mendota Juvenile Treatment Center Admission Psychiatric Evaluation, received and filed.
from Nicolla Dodd dated 2/1/16, received and filed.

Attorney William Joseph Reddin in court, defendant Paris G Crossley not in court, in custody (not produced).  

Matter here for sentencing.  Due to the Court being in trial and unavailable, the matter had to be adjourned.  The matter is adjourned for sentencing to February 2, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

--from victim, Michael S., received and filed.
--from victim, Jollene Y., received and filed.
received and filed.
The Department of Corrections informed the Court that the PSI will not be done by January 21, 2016.  Parties agreed to adjourn the matter to January 28, 2016 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Paris G Crossley in court with Attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Defendant Paris G Crossley in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  As to plea:  AS TO COUNTS #1 AND #3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNTS #2, #4 AND #5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

The State requests a PSI.  The Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  The January 11, 2016 Jury Trial is VACATED.  Matter is set for sentencing on January 21, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

FILED, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Paris G Crossley in court with Attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Defendant Paris G Crossley in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter is here for a Plea Hearing.  There is a possible global resolution with all cases.  The Court VACATED the November 30, 2015 jury trial date.  Matter is adjourned for final pre-trial on December 18, 2015 at 8:30am and a Jury Trial date of January 11, 2016 at 9:00am

David Robles for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Doctor's Report Return.  Hearing proceeded.  There being no challenge to the report of Dr. Kevin Murtaugh M.D. dated 8-27-15 from the state, defense counsel or defendant, the court found the defendant competent to proceed and ordered the proceedings reinstated.  Bail as ordered prior to case being suspended (50,000 CASH with tot JusticePoint).  Parties in a contest posture.  Denis Stingl for the State now present; dates selected.  Filed, Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
from Dr. Kevin Murtaugh dated 8/27/15, filed.

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Paris G Crossley not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a doctor's report return.  Defendant was suppose to be examined.  The defendant just arrived at Mendota on August 14, 2015.  Examination has not been completed.  Defendant being uncooperative.  Defendant remanded into custody once the examination is completed.  Bail needs to be reinstated at next hearing.

Matter adjourned to September 2, 2015 at 8:30am in Judge Conen's Court, Br. 30

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defendant had informed court deputy that Attorney Tishberg had been retained by his family.  Attorney Tishberg did not appear or contact the court regarding this matter.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JESUS S., DAVID C-C., MICHAEL S., CEDRIC M., JOLIENE Y. AND TIODOLO D.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Paris G Crossley in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons as FRIEND of the court.  Atty Mark Tishberg has been retained for future appearances.  Defendant Paris G Crossley in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  ALL PARTIES AGREED TO CASE BEING SET PRIOR TO FIVE BUSINESS DAYS WITH INTENTIONS OF WAIVING PRELIMINARY HEARING IN PRELIM COURT.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
